sen.j: 宇治市（うじし）は、京都府の南部に位置し、世界遺産ともなっている平等院や宇治茶などで知られる市である。
sen.e: Uji City is located in the south of Kyoto Prefecture and is known for Uji tea and the Byodo-in Temple registered as World Heritage.
Uji City is located in the south of Kyoto Prefecture and is known for Uji tea and the Byodo-in Temple which are registered on the World Heritage list.
sen.cmt: World Heritage is a list, rewrote sentence to accommodate
sen.e: Located in the south of Kyoto Prefecture, Uji City is known for Uji tea and the Byodo-in Temple, which is registered on the World Heritage list.
sen.cmt: The use of "which are" implies that Uji tea is registered as a World Heritage site.

sen.j: 西側に巨椋池干拓地があり、現在は農地と住宅街になっている。
sen.e: The reclaimed land from the Ogura-ike (Ogura pond) lies in the east of the city and is used for farming and housing now.
The reclaimed land from the Ogura-ike (Ogura pond) lies in the east of the city and is used for farming as well as housing now.
sen.cmt: Can't use "and" twice in a sentence
sen.e: Land was reclaimed from the Ogura-ike (Ogura Pond) in the west of the city, and this is now used for farming as well as housing.
sen.cmt: This would be a little more natural, I think. Also, while I agree that an "and" should not appear immediately after another "and" in a list (e.g. A and B and C), and if the use of more than one "and" introduces any ambiguity as to the meaning, it should be avoided, but I don't know of any rule that expressly forbids the use of "and" twice in one sentence.east→west

sen.j: 646年 元興寺の僧道登が宇治橋を架ける
sen.e: Doto, a monk at the Gango-ji Temple, built the Uji Bridge in 646.
Doto, a monk at the Gango-ji Temple, built the Uji Bridge in 646.
646: Doto, a monk at the Gango-ji Temple, built the Uji Bridge.
sen.cmt: 「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 672年 近江朝、宇治橋守に命じて大海人皇子の私糧運送を妨害させる
sen.e: The Omi court ordered a hashimori (bridge guard) for the Uji Bridge to interfere with the transport of food for Prince Oamano in 672.
The Omi court ordered a hashimori (bridge guard) for the Uji Bridge to interfere with the transport of food for Prince Oamano in 672.
672: The Omi court ordered a hashimori (bridge guard) for the Uji Bridge to interfere with the transport of food for Prince Oamano.

sen.j: 1052年 藤原頼通、宇治に平等院を建立する
sen.e: In 1052, FUJIWARA no Yorimichi built the Byodo-in Temple in Uji.
In 1052, FUJIWARA no Yorimichi built the Byodo-in Temple in Uji.
1052: FUJIWARA no Yorimichi built the Byodo-in Temple in Uji.

sen.j: 1133年 宇治離宮祭が行われる
sen.e: The Uji Rikyu Festival was held in 1133.
The Uji Rikyu Festival was held in 1133.
1133: The Uji Rikyu Festival was first held.
sen.cmt: 同上I assume this festival was not held only once.

sen.j: 1180年 以仁王が源頼政と組んで挙兵、平等院で平家軍と戦い戦死
sen.e: Mochihito-o along with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa raised an army, fought against the Heike family at the Byodo-in Temple, and died in the battle.
Mochihito-o along with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa raised an army, fought against the Heike family at the Byodo-in Temple, and died in the battle.
1180: Mochihito-o along with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa took up arms, fought against the Taira family at the Byodo-in Temple, and died in the battle.
sen.cmt: 同上in 1180補足Heike→Taira"raised an army" -> "took up arms" に変更しました。

sen.e: In 1183, the Battle of Ujigawa occurred.
In 1183, the Battle of Ujigawa occurred.

sen.j: 源義経、木曽義仲軍を破る
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune defeated Yoshinaka KISO's army.
MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune defeated Yoshinaka KISO's army.
MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune defeated Yoshinaka KISO's army.
In 1221, the Jokyu no Ran (Jokyu Rebellion) occurred.
In 1221, the Jokyu no Ran (Jokyu Rebellion) occurred.
1221: The Jokyu no Ran (Jokyu Rebellion) occurred.
sen.cmt: 「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府、宇治川から伏見を攻める
sen.e: The Kamakura Bakufu attacked Fushimi across the Uji River.
The Kamakura Bakufu attacked Fushimi across the Uji River.
The Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) attacked Fushimi across the Uji River.
sen.cmt: Bakufu→bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)

sen.j: 1286年 叡尊、宇治橋大改修の供養を修して、亀山・後深草上皇が臨幸
sen.e: In 1286, Eison consoled the soul of the dead to renovate the Uji Bridge extensively, and the retired Emperor Kameyama and the retired Emperor Gofukakusa paid a visit.
In 1286, Eison consoled the soul of the dead in order to conduct extensive renovations of the Uji Bridge. Former Emperors Kameyama and Gofukakusa pay a visit.
1286: Eison conducted a memorial service for the souls of the dead following extensive renovations made to the Uji Bridge with the Retired Emperors Kameyama and Gofukakusa in attendance.
sen.cmt: 同上"retired" -> "Retired"The Japanese is not vey clear in my opinion, but I think the corrections to the left would improve the translation. I do think that "Eison consoled the soul of the dead" seems quite unnatural and including the information about the retired emperors in a separate sentence suggests there is no connection between their visit and the memorial service.

sen.j: 1486年 山城国一揆衆、宇治平等院に集まり国中の掟を定める
sen.e: In 1486, the rebels in the Yamashiro-no-kuni Ikki (Yamashiro Province Riot) gathered at the Uji Byodo-in Temple, and they set the Kuniju-no-okite (rules for the province).
In 1486, the rebels in the Yamashiro-no-kuni Ikki (Yamashiro Province Riot) gathered at the Uji Byodo-in Temple, and set the Kuniju-no-okite (rules for the province).
1486: The rebels in the Yamashiro-no-kuni Ikki (Yamashiro Province Riot) gathered at the Uji Byodo-in Temple, and set the Kuniju-no-okite (rules for the province).
sen.cmt: 「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 1573年 足利義昭、宇治の槙島城にて挙兵するも失敗、織田信長に追放される
sen.e: In 1573, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA attempted to raise an army in Makishima-jo Castle in Uji, but failed; he was expelled by Nobunaga ODA.
In 1573, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA attempted to raise an army in Makishima-jo Castle in Uji, but failed; he was expelled by Nobunaga ODA.
1573: Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA attempted to raise an army in Makishima-jo Castle in Uji, but failed; he was expelled by Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 3月1日、久世郡宇治町、槇島村、小倉村、大久保村、宇治郡東宇治町の2町3村が合併して、宇治市が成立する。
sen.e: On March 1, two towns of Uji-cho in Kuse-gun and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun and three villages of Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura and kubo-mura were combined to form Uji City.
On March 1, the two towns of Uji-cho in Kuse-gun and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun, together with the three villages of Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura as well as kubo-mura were combined to form Uji City.
sen.cmt: Can't use and twice in a sentence
sen.e: March 1: The two towns of Uji-cho in Kuse-gun and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun, together with the three villages of Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura as well as Okubo-mura were combined to form Uji City.
sen.cmt: 「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。kubo-mura→Okubo-mura

tit.cmt: Politics and government→Administration 他の記事に合わせました。

sen.j: トランプやテレビゲームで有名な任天堂も市内に全工場3個を保有している。
sen.e: Nintendo, famous for cards and video games, possesses all of its three factories in the city.
Nintendo, famous for cards and video games, possesses all three of its factories in the city.
sen.cmt: changed to -> possesses all three of its factories
sen.e: Nintendo, famous for cards and video games, possesses all three of its factories in the city.

sen.j: 京都アニメーションの本社が立地している。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation is headquartered in the city.
Kyoto Animation is headquartered in the city.
Kyoto Animation is headquartered in the city.

sen.j: 日本レイヨン株式会社の主力工場である宇治工場が、大正15年（1925年）12月に完成する。
sen.e: The Uji factory, the main factory of Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd., was completed in December 1925.
The Uji factory, the main factory of Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd., was completed in December 1925.
The Uji factory, the main factory of Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd., was completed in December 1925.

sen.j: 豊富な宇治川の水源を求め、また、広大な事業用地の確保に打って付けの場所故のことである。
sen.e: The company built the factory there because of the relatively easy procurement of vast commercial land and an abundant water supply from the Uji River.
The company built the factory there because of the relatively easy procurement of vast commercial land and an abundant water supply from the Uji River.
The company built the factory there because of the relatively easy procurement of vast commercial land and an abundant water supply from the Uji River.

sen.j: 翌年の2月より操業開始する。
sen.e: In February, the following year, the factory began its operation.
In February, the following year, operation of the factory commenced.
sen.cmt: A factory can't "begin" its own operation
sen.e: In February, the following year, operation of the factory commenced.

sen.j: 以来、レーヨン・ナイロンなどの化学繊維を製造してきた。
sen.e: The factory has produced chemical fiber such as rayon and nylon ever since.
The factory has produced chemical fiber such as rayon and nylon ever since.
The factory has produced chemical fiber such as rayon and nylon ever since.

sen.j: 昭和44年（1969年）10月には親会社であったニチボー株式会社と合併し、ユニチカ株式会社が発足し、総合化学メーカーとして歩み出す。
sen.e: In October, 1969, Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd. and its parent company, Nichibo Co., Ltd. were merged to form Unittika, Ltd., paving the way for the diversified chemicals manufacturer.
In October, 1969, Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd. and its parent company, Nichibo Co., Ltd. were merged to form Unittika, Ltd., paving the way for the diversified chemicals manufacturer.
sen.cmt: Nichibo Co., Ltd. were merged -> Nichibo Co., Ltd. merged
sen.e: In October 1969, Nippon Rayon Co., Ltd. and its parent company, Nichibo Co., Ltd. were merged to form Unittika, Ltd., paving the way for the diversified chemicals manufacturer.

sen.j: 現在はポリエステルフィルムやプラスチック製造に特化した工場として規模を小さくしながらも、ユニチカの基幹事業を担っている。
sen.e: The factory has still played an active role in the core business of Unittika even though it has been slimmed down to focus on the production of polyester films and plastics.
The factory has still played an active role in the core business of Unittika even though it has been slimmed down to focus on the production of polyester films and plastics.
The factory has still played an active role in the core business of Unittika even though it has been slimmed down to focus on the production of polyester films and plastics.

sen.j: かつては市内には日産自動車の子会社である日産車体の京都工場があったものの、1999年に経営不振のために閉鎖された。
sen.e: There used to be the Kyoto factory of Nissan Shatai Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., in the city, but the factory was shut down in 1999 due to financial difficulties.
The Kyoto factory of Nissan Shatai Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., used to be located in the city, but the factory was shut down in 1999 due to financial difficulties.
sen.cmt: There used to be the Kyoto factory of Nissan Shatai Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., in the city, -> The Kyoto factory xxx in the city used to be located in the city,
sen.e: The Kyoto factory of Nissan Shatai Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., used to be located in the city, but the factory was shut down in 1999 due to financial difficulties.

sen.j: 現在の自動車産業は、その日産車体の子会社であるやゼロがある。
sen.e: In the auto industry of Uji City, AUTO WORKS KYOTO Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Shatai, and Zero (ゼロ) currently operate.
sen.cmt: 「その日産車体の子会社である」の後の会社名が原文で抜けていたようなので、現在のWikipediaを参照して「オートワークス京都」を挿入しました。
sen.e: AUTO WORKS KYOTO Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Shatai, and Zero (ゼロ), currently operate in the auto industry of Uji City.
sen.cmt: In the auto industry of Uji City, AUTO WORKS KYOTO Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Shatai, and Zero (ゼロ) currently operate.->AUTO WORKS KYOTO Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Shatai, and Zero (ゼロ), currently operate in the auto industry of Uji City.
sen.e: AUTO WORKS KYOTO Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Nissan Shatai, and Zero (ゼロ), currently operate in the auto industry of Uji City.

sen.j: また、隣の久御山町にはがあり、この地域では日産関連の施設が多い。
sen.e: Additionally, there is Nissan Technical School Kyoto in the neighboring town of Kumiyama-cho, and are many more facilities related to Nissan in the area.
sen.cmt: 上と同じく「隣の久御山町には」の後が抜けていますので「日産京都自動車大学校を」を挿入しました。
sen.e: Additionally, there is Nissan Technical School Kyoto in the neighboring town of Kumiyama-cho, with many more facilities related to Nissan in the area.
Additionally, there is Nissan Technical School Kyoto in the neighboring town of Kumiyama-cho, with many more facilities related to Nissan in the area.

sen.j: ヌワラエリヤ市 （スリランカ、1986年4月12日）
咸陽市 （中華人民共和国 陝西省、1986年7月24日）
カムループス （カナダ ブリティッシュコロンビア州、1990年7月1日）
宇治茶の産地なのでそれにちなんだ地域教育を公立の小中学校で行われている。
sen.e: Because Uji is a producer of Uji tea, the community education programs on the tea were provided in public elementary and junior high schools.
Since Uji is a producer of Uji tea, community education programs on tea were provided through public elementary and junior high schools.
sen.cmt: "Because" shouldn't be used to start a sentencethe community education programs on the tea -> community education programs on teain public elementary -> through public elementary
sen.e: Since Uji is a producer of Uji tea, community education programs on tea were provided through public elementary and junior high schools.

sen.j: その一環として、茶飲み場施設があり、蛇口よりお茶を出す食育を行っている。
sen.e: As part of the programs to provide dietary education, schools have a facility to serve tea from the faucet.
As part of the programs to provide dietary education, schools have a facility to serve tea from the faucet.
sen.cmt: As part of the programs to provide dietary education, schools have a facility to serve tea from the faucet. ->As part of this, dietary education is carried out which involves schools possessing a facility to serve tea from faucets,
sen.e: As part of the programs to provide dietary education, schools have a facility to serve tea from the faucet.

tit.cmt: Railroad→Railways 他の記事に合わせました。

sen.j: 近鉄京都線、京阪宇治線、奈良線、京都市営地下鉄東西線の4線。
sen.e: There are four railroad lines: the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, the Keihan Uji Line, the Nara Line, and the Tozai Line of the Kyoto City Subway.
There are four railroad lines: the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, the Keihan Uji Line, the Nara Line, and the Tozai Line of the Kyoto City Subway.
There are four railway lines: the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, the Keihan Uji Line, the Nara Line, and the Tozai Line of the Kyoto City Subway.
sen.cmt: Railroad→Railways 他の記事に合わせました。

sen.j: 市の位置的中心地であり、市役所への最寄り駅である駅は、JR奈良線の宇治駅 (JR西日本)であるが、利用者数は近鉄京都線の大久保駅 (京都府)が一番多く、実質こちらが市の中心駅である。
sen.e: The Uji Station (JR West) on the JR Nara Line is located in the center of Uji City and the closest to the city hall, but the Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, ranking first in the number of passengers, is the de facto central station of the city.

The Uji Station (JR West) on the JR Nara Line is located in the center of Uji City and the closest to the city hall, but the Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, ranking first in the number of passengers, is the de facto central station of the city.
sen.cmt: and the closest to the city hall, -> and is closest to the city hall. but the -> However the,ranking first -> which ranks first
sen.e: The Uji Station (JR West) on the JR Nara Line is located in the center of Uji City and the closest to the city hall, but the Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, ranking first in the number of passengers, is the de facto central station of the city.

sen.j: 3駅 - 小倉駅 (京都府)、伊勢田駅、大久保駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Three stations: Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Iseda Station, and Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)

sen.j: 市の西部を国道24号が南北に通り、東西には京滋バイパスが通過している。
